title: Variables and Data Types
description:
Practice creating and using different data types in Ruby: strings, numbers, booleans.

Steps:
1. Implement `favorite_language.class.to_s` so `favorite_language.class.to_s` returns "String".
2. Implement `my_age.class.to_s` so `my_age.class.to_s` returns "Integer".
3. Implement `my_age > 0` so `my_age > 0` returns true.
4. Implement `ruby_is_awesome?` so `ruby_is_awesome?` returns true.

Expected results:
- `favorite_language.class.to_s` returns "String"
- `my_age.class.to_s` returns "Integer"
- `my_age > 0` returns true
- `ruby_is_awesome?` returns true

hints: Strings are text wrapped in quotes: "like this"
Integers are whole numbers without quotes: 25
Booleans are true or false (no quotes)
Method names can end with ? for boolean returns
Just return the value - Ruby returns the last expression
